A component to select a date.

See Also:
isUpdateYearsOnChange()

isUpdateYearsOnChange

public boolean isUpdateYearsOnChange()
Sets the updateYearsOnChange property. The years in the year menu are displayed from (currentYear - minYearAmount) to (currentYear + maxYearAmount). If updateYearsOnChange property is set then every time the year is changed (either the user selects a new year, either programatically) the years in the year menu are changed accordingly. Otherwise the initial years are always displayed in the menu.

See Also:
isUpdateYearsOnChange()

setUpdateYearsOnChange

public void setUpdateYearsOnChange(boolean updateYearsOnChange)
Sets the updateYearsOnChange property

getWeekDayDisplayType

public int getWeekDayDisplayType()
Returns how the column names will be displayed. The possible values are
ONE
only the first character of the week day will be displayed
SHORT
the short name of the week day will be displayed
LONG
the entire name of the week day will be displayed

setWeekDayDisplayType

Sets how the column names will be displayed. The possible values are
ONE
only the first character of the week day will be displayed
SHORT
the short name of the week day will be displayed
LONG
the entire name of the week day will be displayed

Parameters:
weekDayDisplayType - the display type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given display type is not one of the three values

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String property)
Returns a color property associated with this calendar. Every property has a prefix and a suffix. The suffix can be either ".Background" or ".Foreground" for the background, respectively foreground color. The only property that makes an exception to this is "Calendar.Grid" which represents the color for the grid between cells. The possible prefix properties and the evaluation order are the same as the font properties.

See Also:
getFont(java.lang.String)

setColor

public void setColor(java.lang.String property,
                     java.awt.Color color)
Sets a color property associated with this calendar.

See Also:
getColor(java.lang.String)

getFont

public java.awt.Font getFont(java.lang.String property)
Returns a font property associated with this calendar. The possible properties and their associated meanings are:
Calendar.PreviousMonth
the days in the calendar for the previous month to the one displayed
Calendar.PreviousMonth.Selected
the days in the calendar for the previous month to the one displayed when selected
Calendar.NextMonth
the days in the calendar for the next month to the one displayed
Calendar.NextMonth.Selected
the days in the calendar for the next month to the one displayed when selected
Calendar.Today
the current date in calendar
Calendar.Today.Selected
the current date in calendar when selected
Calendar.Header
the column names in the calendar header
Calendar.Header.WeekDay.x
the column name in the calendar header associated with the x day of the week
Calendar.WeekDay.x
the x day of the week in calendar (not the column number x)
Calendar.WeekDay.x.Selected
the x day of the week in calendar when selected
Calendar.Week.x
the x week in calendar
Calendar.Week.x.Selected
the x week in calendar when selected
Calendar
the days in the calendar
Calendar.Selected
the days in the calendar when selected
Calendar.Controls
the controls
The order in which the calendar looks for properties is the one displayed above. It means that if we have Calendar.WeekDay.1 = Times and Calendar.Week.1 = Courier then the first day in week of the first week will be displayed with the Times font

setFont

public void setFont(java.lang.String property,
                    java.awt.Font font)
Sets a font property associated with this calendar.

See Also:
getFont(java.lang.String)
